task_summary: The robot must pick up the red object placed on the table using its gripper, following a structured sequence of perception, alignment, grasp, and lift.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a robotic arm equipped with a parallel-jaw gripper, performing a pick-up task of a brightly colored red cubic object situated on a blue-marked area of a table. The robot begins with perception to locate the object, approaches from above, verifies its position, gently grasps the object, and lifts it clear of the surface. No visible obstacles are present, and the blue tape markers provide consistent reference for both robot and observer. Environment lighting and object pose remain stable through the episode. The system must avoid knocking over or misaligning the object and ensure a secure grasp before lifting.
preconditions: Red object is present on the table and unobstructed
Robot gripper is open and ready
Vision system operational; object visible or reacquirable
stepwise_plan: Check visibility of the red object
Scan if object not initially visible
Open the gripper to proper width
Move above the red object at a safe offset
Approach and align to the object's center
Lower gradually until contact is detected
Close gripper to grasp object gently
success_criteria: Red object securely held in gripper
No significant object displacement on table before grasp
Object lifted clear from contact with table
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect object — retry up to 3 times
Unstable or missed grasp — repeat alignment/grasp steps
Contact not detected — limit lowering depth and abort if necessary
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the red object is confirmed in gripper and elevated above table by at least 5 cm.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is visible to sensors
Scans the scene in raster pattern up to 3 times to locate red object
Detects precise location and pose of the red object
Opens gripper to pick width for object pickup
Moves end-effector above red object prior to approach
Fine approach and alignment to object's center with tight tolerance
Slowly lowers gripper until contact with object is detected
Closes gripper with low force to gently grasp object
Verifies object is held by the gripper
Lifts the gripped object by 5 cm above the table

failure_modes: Object not detected after 3 scan attempts
Grasp failure due to alignment or width mismatch
Object slips from gripper after close
recovery_strategy: Retry visual scan if object not seen
Realign and repeat approach if grasp unstable
Abort lowering if contact not reached within max depth
assumptions: The red object is present and static throughout the episode
Instruction requests pick and lift only; no place required or visible in frames
Frames confirm only the pickup phase, and do not show object being placed

expected_success_criteria: Red object is visible, grasped, and lifted by gripper
